title.raw: 《田單列傳》 Biography of Tian Dan

sentences.zh: 田單者，齊諸田疏屬也。

translations.literal: Tian Dan was Qi various Tian distant relative.

sentences.zh: 湣王時，單為臨菑市掾，不見知。

translations.literal: Min Wang time, Dan was Linzi market assistant, not seen known.

sentences.zh: 及燕使樂毅伐破齊，齊湣王出奔，已而保莒城。

translations.literal: When Yan sent Yue Yi attacked broke Qi, Qi Min Wang fled out, soon after defended Ju city.

sentences.zh: 燕師長驅平齊，而田單走安平，令其宗人盡斷其車軸末而傅鐵籠。

translations.literal: Yan army long drove pacified Qi, yet Tian Dan fled Anping, ordered his clansmen all cut their cart axle ends and attached iron cages.

sentences.zh: 已而燕軍攻安平，城壞，齊人走，爭涂，以折車敗，為燕所虜，唯田單宗人以鐵籠故得脫，東保即墨。

translations.literal: Soon after Yan army attacked Anping, city broken, Qi people fled, contended roads, with broken carts defeated, captured by Yan, only Tian Dan clansmen because iron cage reason got escape, east defended Jimo.

sentences.zh: 燕既盡降齊城，唯獨莒、即墨不下。

translations.literal: Yan having all surrendered Qi cities, only alone Ju, Jimo not fell.

sentences.zh: 燕軍聞齊王在莒，并兵攻之。

translations.literal: Yan army heard Qi king in Ju, combined troops attacked it.

sentences.zh: 淖齒既殺湣王於莒，因堅守，距燕軍，數年不下。

translations.literal: Nao Chi having killed Min Wang in Ju, thus firmly defended, resisted Yan army, several years not fell.

sentences.zh: 燕引兵東圍即墨，即墨大夫出與戰，敗死。

translations.literal: Yan led troops east surrounded Jimo, Jimo grandee went out fought with them, defeated died.

sentences.zh: 城中相與推田單，曰：「安平之戰，田單宗人以鐵籠得全，習兵。」

translations.literal: City middle mutually pushed Tian Dan, said: 'Anping battle, Tian Dan clansmen with iron cages got whole, familiar with troops.'

sentences.zh: 立以為將軍，以即墨距燕。

translations.literal: Established him as general, with Jimo resisted Yan.

Tian Dan was a distant relative of the Tian clan of Qi. During King Min's time, Dan served as market supervisor in Linzi, unrecognized. When Yan sent Yue Yi to attack and break Qi, Qi King Min fled, then defended Ju city. Yan troops drove straight to pacify Qi, while Tian Dan fled to Anping, ordered his clansmen to all cut their chariot axle ends and fit iron casings. Soon Yan army attacked Anping. City broken, Qi people fled, contended on roads, axes broke chariots, captured by Yan. Only Tian Dan's clansmen with iron casings escaped, east to defend Jimu. Yan having completely subdued Qi cities, only Ju and Jimu not fallen. Yan army heard Qi king in Ju, combined forces attacked it. Zhao Chi having killed King Min in Ju, thus firmly defended, resisted Yan army, several years not fallen. Yan led troops east to besiege Jimu. Jimu officials went out to battle, defeated and died. City people together promoted Tian Dan, saying: 'In Anping battle, Tian Dan's clansmen with iron casings survived, practiced in arms.' Established him as general, to defend Jimu against Yan.

sentences.zh: 頃之，燕昭王卒，惠王立，與樂毅有隙。

translations.literal: Soon after, Yan Zhao Wang died, Hui Wang ascended, with Yue Yi had rift.

sentences.zh: 田單聞之，乃縱反閒於燕，宣言曰：「齊王已死，城之不拔者二耳。

translations.literal: Tian Dan heard this, then released reverse spies in Yan, declared said: 'Qi king already dead, cities not captured two only.

sentences.zh: 樂毅畏誅而不敢歸，以伐齊為名，實欲連兵南面而王齊。

translations.literal: Yue Yi feared execution not dared return, with attacking Qi as name, really wished connect troops south face become king of Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊人未附，故且緩攻即墨以待其事。

translations.literal: Qi people not attached, thus moreover slow attack Jimo to wait for his affairs.

sentences.zh: 齊人所懼，唯恐他將之來，即墨殘矣。」

translations.literal: Qi people what fear, only fear other general come, Jimo finished.'

sentences.zh: 燕王以為然，使騎劫代樂毅。

translations.literal: Yan king considered it so, sent Qi Jie replace Yue Yi.

Soon, Yan King Zhao died, King Hui ascended, had rift with Yue Yi. Tian Dan heard of this, spread false rumors in Yan, declaring: 'Qi king already dead, cities not fallen are two only.' Yue Yi fears execution dares not return, using attacking Qi as name, actually wishes to join forces facing south to become king of Qi.' Qi people not attached, thus slowly attacks Jimu awaiting the matter.' What Qi fears is only other generals coming, then Jimu finished.' Yan king considered it true, sent Ji Jie to replace Yue Yi.

sentences.zh: 樂毅因歸趙，燕人士卒忿。

translations.literal: Yue Yi thus returned Zhao, Yan officials soldiers angry.

sentences.zh: 而田單乃令城中人食必祭其先祖於庭，飛鳥悉翔舞城中下食。

translations.literal: Yet Tian Dan then ordered city middle people eat must sacrifice their ancestors in courtyard, flying birds all soar dance city middle eat food.

sentences.zh: 燕人怪之。

translations.literal: Yan people strange it.

sentences.zh: 田單因宣言曰：「神來下教我。」

translations.literal: Tian Dan thus declared said: 'Spirit come down teach me.'

sentences.zh: 乃令城中人曰：「當有神人為我師。」

translations.literal: Then ordered city middle people said: 'Should have divine person be my teacher.'

sentences.zh: 有一卒曰：「臣可以為師乎？」

translations.literal: Had one soldier said: 'Minister can be teacher?'

sentences.zh: 因反走。

translations.literal: Thus turned fled.

sentences.zh: 田單乃起，引還，東鄉坐，師事之。

translations.literal: Tian Dan then rose, drew back, east facing sat, teacher served him.

sentences.zh: 卒曰：「臣欺君，誠無能也。」

translations.literal: Soldier said: 'Minister deceived lord, truly without ability.'

sentences.zh: 田單曰：「子勿言也！」

translations.literal: Tian Dan said: 'Child not speak!'

sentences.zh: 因師之。

translations.literal: Thus teacher him.

sentences.zh: 每出約束，必稱神師。

translations.literal: Every go out regulations, must call divine teacher.

sentences.zh: 乃宣言曰：「吾唯懼燕軍之劓所得齊卒，置之前行，與我戰，即墨敗矣。」

translations.literal: Then declared said: 'I only fear Yan army cut noses of captured Qi soldiers, place in front ranks, fight with us, Jimo defeated.'

sentences.zh: 燕人聞之，如其言。

translations.literal: Yan people heard this, as his words.

sentences.zh: 城中人見齊諸降者盡劓，皆怒，堅守，唯恐見得。

translations.literal: City middle people saw Qi various surrendered ones all noses cut, all angry, firm defend, only fear be captured.

sentences.zh: 單又縱反閒曰：「吾懼燕人掘吾城外冢墓，僇先人，可為寒心。」

translations.literal: Dan again released reverse spies said: 'I fear Yan people dig my city outside tombs graves, mutilate ancestors, can be chilling heart.'

sentences.zh: 燕軍盡掘壟墓，燒死人。

translations.literal: Yan army all dug up mounds graves, burned dead people.

sentences.zh: 即墨人從城上望見，皆涕泣，俱欲出戰，怒自十倍。

translations.literal: Jimo people from city wall saw, all tears wept, all wished go out battle, anger from ten times.

Yue Yi thus went to Zhao, Yan officers and soldiers resentful. Tian Dan then ordered city people when eating must sacrifice to ancestors in courtyards, flying birds all soared and danced eating in city. Yan people considered it strange. Tian Dan thus declared: 'Spirit comes down to teach me.' Then ordered city people: 'There should be a spirit person to be my teacher.' One soldier said: 'Can I be the teacher?' Thus ran backward. Tian Dan rose, led him back, faced east sat, treated him as teacher. Soldier said: 'I deceived you, truly incapable.' Tian Dan said: 'Do not speak!' Thus treated him as teacher. Whenever going out to give orders, must call divine teacher. Then declared: 'I only fear Yan army will cut noses of captured Qi soldiers, place them in front, battle with me, then Jimu defeated.' Yan heard this, did as said. City people saw all surrendered Qi with cut noses, all angered, firmly defended, feared being captured. Dan again spread false rumors: 'I fear Yan people dig my city outer tombs, dishonor ancestors, can chill the heart.' Yan army completely dug up mounds and tombs, burned corpses. Jimu people from city walls saw, all wept, all wished to go out battle, anger increased tenfold.

sentences.zh: 田單知士卒之可用，乃身操版插，與士卒分功，妻妾編於行伍之閒，盡散飲食饗士。

translations.literal: Tian Dan knew soldiers usable, then personally grasped carrying pole, with soldiers share labor, wives concubines arranged among ranks, all scattered food drink feast soldiers.

sentences.zh: 令甲卒皆伏，使老弱女子乘城，遣使約降於燕，燕軍皆呼萬歲。

translations.literal: Ordered armored soldiers all hide, made old weak women defend city, sent envoy agree surrender to Yan, Yan army all called ten thousand years.

sentences.zh: 田單又收民金，得千溢，令即墨富豪遺燕將，曰：「即墨即降，願無虜掠吾族家妻妾，令安堵。」

translations.literal: Tian Dan again collected people's gold, got thousand yi, ordered Jimo rich merchants send to Yan general, said: 'Jimo immediately surrender, wish not plunder our clan families wives concubines, let peaceful dwell.'

sentences.zh: 燕將大喜，許之。

translations.literal: Yan general greatly happy, promised it.

sentences.zh: 燕軍由此益懈。

translations.literal: Yan army from this increasingly lax.

Tian Dan knowing soldiers usable, personally handled board and trowel, shared labor with soldiers, wives and concubines wove among ranks, completely distributed food and drink to feast soldiers. Ordered armored soldiers all hide, made old weak women ascend walls, sent envoys to arrange surrender to Yan. Yan army all called ten thousand years. Tian Dan again collected people's gold, got thousand yi, had Jimu rich merchants send to Yan general: 'Jimu about to surrender, wish not to plunder our clans families wives concubines, let them dwell in peace.' Yan general greatly pleased, agreed. Yan army thus increasingly lax.

sentences.zh: 田單乃收城中得千餘牛，為絳繒衣，畫以五彩龍文，束兵刃於其角，而灌脂束葦於尾，燒其端。

translations.literal: Tian Dan then collected city middle got thousand plus oxen, made crimson silk clothes, painted with five colors dragon patterns, bound weapons on their horns, and poured oil bundled reeds on tails, burned their ends.

sentences.zh: 鑿城數十穴，夜縱牛，壯士五千人隨其後。

translations.literal: Drilled city several tens holes, night released oxen, strong warriors five thousand followed their rear.

sentences.zh: 牛尾熱，怒而奔燕軍，燕軍夜大驚。

translations.literal: Oxen tails hot, angry charged Yan army, Yan army night greatly startled.

sentences.zh: 牛尾炬火光明炫燿，燕軍視之皆龍文，所觸盡死傷。

translations.literal: Oxen tails torch fire bright dazzling, Yan army saw them all dragon patterns, what touched all died injured.

sentences.zh: 五千人因銜枚擊之，而城中鼓譟從之，老弱皆擊銅器為聲，聲動天地。

translations.literal: Five thousand thus bit wooden gag attacked them, and city middle drums roared followed, old weak all struck bronze vessels for sound, sound moved heaven earth.

sentences.zh: 燕軍大駭，敗走。

translations.literal: Yan army greatly terrified, defeated fled.

sentences.zh: 齊人遂夷殺其將騎劫。

translations.literal: Qi people then annihilated killed their general Qi Jie.

sentences.zh: 燕軍擾亂奔走，齊人追亡逐北，所過城邑皆畔燕而歸田單，兵日益多，乘勝，燕日敗亡，卒至河上，而齊七十餘城皆復為齊。

translations.literal: Yan army confused fled, Qi people pursued defeated chased fleeing, what passed cities all rebelled Yan returned to Tian Dan, troops daily increased, riding victory, Yan daily defeated perished, finally reached Yellow River, yet Qi seventy plus cities all recovered as Qi.

sentences.zh: 乃迎襄王於莒，入臨菑而聽政。

translations.literal: Then welcomed Xiang Wang from Ju, entered Linzi listened to government.

Tian Dan collected city cattle over thousand, made crimson silk clothing, painted with five-colored dragon patterns, bound weapons on horns, poured oil and bundled reeds on tails, lit the ends. Dug dozens of holes in city, night released cattle, strong warriors five thousand followed behind. Cattle tails hot, angered and charged Yan army. Yan army night greatly alarmed. Cattle tail torches fire bright dazzling, Yan army saw all dragon patterns, touched all died injured. Five thousand thus silent attacked them, city drummed clamor followed, old weak all struck bronze for sound, sound shook heaven earth. Yan army greatly terrified, defeated fled. Qi people thus slaughtered their general Ji Jie. Yan army chaotic fled, Qi people pursued fleeing defeated, passed cities all rebelled Yan returned to Tian Dan, troops daily increased, taking victory, Yan daily defeated perished, finally to Yellow River, Qi seventy-plus cities all recovered for Qi. Thus welcomed King Xiang at Ju, entered Linzi to hear governance.

sentences.zh: 襄王封田單，號曰安平君。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang enfeoffed Tian Dan, titled An Ping Jun.
King Xiang enfeoffed Tian Dan, titled Lord Anping.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：兵以正合，以奇勝。

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: Warfare with orthodox engages, with extraordinary wins.

sentences.zh: 善之者，出奇無窮。

translations.literal: Skilled at it ones, produce extraordinary inexhaustible.

sentences.zh: 奇正還相生，如環之無端。

translations.literal: Extraordinary orthodox mutually give birth, like ring without end.

sentences.zh: 夫始如處女，適人開戶；

translations.literal: Indeed beginning like virgin, enemy opens door;

sentences.zh: 後如脫兔，適不及距：其由單之謂邪！

translations.literal: Later like escaped rabbit, enemy cannot block: this from Dan called!

The Grand Historian says: Warfare unites with orthodox, conquers with unorthodox. Those skilled at it, unorthodox emerges without limit. Unorthodox and orthodox cycle producing each other, like a ring without end. At first like virgin, enemy opens door; Later like escaped rabbit, enemy cannot catch: this describes Tian Dan!

sentences.zh: 初，淖齒之殺湣王也，莒人求湣王子法章，得之太史嬓之家，為人灌園。

translations.literal: Initially, Nao Chi killed Min Wang, Ju people sought Min Wang son Fa Zhang, got him Grand Historian Tao home, for person irrigated garden.

sentences.zh: 嬓女憐而善遇之。

translations.literal: Tao daughter pitied good treated him.

sentences.zh: 後法章私以情告女，女遂與通。

translations.literal: Later Fa Zhang secretly with feelings told girl, girl then with him had relations.

sentences.zh: 及莒人共立法章為齊王，以莒距燕，而太史氏女遂為后，所謂「君王后」也。

translations.literal: When Ju people together established Fa Zhang as Qi king, with Ju resisted Yan, yet Grand Historian clan girl then became queen, so-called 'Jun Wang Hou'.

Initially, when Zhao Chi killed King Min, Ju people sought King Min's son Fa Zhang, found him at Grand Historian Xi's home, working as gardener. Xi's daughter pitied and treated him well. Later Fa Zhang privately told his feelings to the girl, she then consorted with him. When Ju people together established Fa Zhang as Qi king, to defend Ju against Yan, Grand Historian Xi's daughter became queen, called 'Queen of the King.'

sentences.zh: 燕之初入齊，聞畫邑人王蠋賢，令軍中曰「環畫邑三十里無入」，以王蠋之故。

translations.literal: Yan initially entered Qi, heard Hua yi person Wang Juan worthy, ordered army middle said 'surround Hua yi thirty li none enter', because Wang Juan reason.

sentences.zh: 已而使人謂蠋曰：「齊人多高子之義，吾以子為將，封子萬家。」

translations.literal: Soon after sent person told Juan said: 'Qi people much esteem your righteousness, I make you general, enfeoff you ten thousand households.'

sentences.zh: 蠋固謝。

translations.literal: Juan firmly declined.

sentences.zh: 燕人曰：「子不聽，吾引三軍而屠畫邑。」

translations.literal: Yan person said: 'You not listen, I lead three armies slaughter Hua yi.'

sentences.zh: 王蠋曰：「忠臣不事二君，貞女不更二夫。

translations.literal: Wang Juan said: 'Loyal minister not serve two lords, chaste woman not change two husbands.

sentences.zh: 齊王不聽吾諫，故退而耕於野。

translations.literal: Qi king not listen my advice, thus retreated farmed in wilds.

sentences.zh: 國既破亡，吾不能存；

translations.literal: State already broken perished, I cannot preserve;

sentences.zh: 今又劫之以兵為君將，是助桀為暴也。

translations.literal: Now again coerce with troops make me your general, this help Jie do tyranny.

sentences.zh: 與其生而無義，固不如烹！」

translations.literal: Rather than live without righteousness, certainly better to be cooked!'

sentences.zh: 遂經其頸於樹枝，自奮絕脰而死。

translations.literal: Then hung his neck on tree branch, self exerted broke neck died.

sentences.zh: 齊亡大夫聞之，曰：「王蠋，布衣也，義不北面於燕，況在位食祿者乎！」

translations.literal: Qi perished grandees heard this, said: 'Wang Juan, commoner, righteousness not face north to Yan, moreover officials in position eating salary!'

sentences.zh: 乃相聚如莒，求諸子，立為襄王。

translations.literal: Then mutually gathered like Ju, sought various sons, established as Xiang Wang.

When Yan first entered Qi, heard Hua county man Wang Xu worthy, ordered army: 'Circle Hua county thirty li no entry,' because of Wang Xu. Then sent people to tell Xu: 'Qi people much praise your righteousness, I appoint you general, enfeoff you ten thousand households.' Xu firmly declined. Yan people said: 'If you do not listen, I lead three armies to butcher Hua county.' Wang Xu said: 'Loyal minister does not serve two lords, chaste woman does not take two husbands.' Qi king did not listen to my advice, thus retired to farm in wilds.' State already broken perished, I could not preserve it; Now again coerce with arms to be lord's general, this assists tyrant in violence.' Better than living without righteousness, certainly rather boiled!' Thus hanged his neck on tree branch, struggled and broke neck died. Qi perished ministers heard of this, said: 'Wang Xu, commoner also, righteousness does not face north to Yan, how much more those in office eating salary!' Thus gathered at Ju, sought the princes, established as King Xiang.
